name: siteVerification
title: Google Site Verification API
description: Verifies ownership of websites or domains with Google.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

fields.name: site
fields.desc: The site for which a verification token will be generated.

fields.name: identifier
fields.desc: The site identifier. If the type is set to SITE, the identifier is a URL. If the type is set to INET_DOMAIN, the site identifier is a domain name.

fields.name: type
fields.desc: The type of resource to be verified. Can be SITE or INET_DOMAIN (domain name).

fields.name: verificationMethod
fields.desc: The verification method that will be used to verify this site. For sites, 'FILE' or 'META' methods may be used. For domains, only 'DNS' may be used.

fields.name: token
fields.desc: The verification token. The token must be placed appropriately in order for verification to succeed.

fields.name: method
fields.desc: The verification method to use in conjunction with this token. For FILE, the token should be placed in the top-level directory of the site, stored inside a file of the same name. For META, the token should be placed in the HEAD tag of the default page that is loaded for the site. For DNS, the token should be placed in a TXT record of the domain.

fields.name: items
fields.desc: The list of sites that are owned by the authenticated user.

fields.name: site
fields.desc: The address and type of a site that is verified or will be verified.

fields.name: identifier
fields.desc: The site identifier. If the type is set to SITE, the identifier is a URL. If the type is set to INET_DOMAIN, the site identifier is a domain name.

fields.name: type
fields.desc: The site type. Can be SITE or INET_DOMAIN (domain name).

fields.name: id
fields.desc: The string used to identify this site. This value should be used in the "id" portion of the REST URL for the Get, Update, and Delete operations.

fields.name: owners
fields.desc: The email addresses of all verified owners.

methods.name: getToken
methods.desc: Get a verification token for placing on a website or domain.

methods.name: insert
methods.desc: Attempt verification of a website or domain.

requiredQueryParams.name: verificationMethod
requiredQueryParams.desc: The method to use for verifying a site or domain.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Get the list of your verified websites and domains.

methods.name: patch
methods.desc: Modify the list of owners for your website or domain. This method supports patch semantics.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The id of a verified site or domain.

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Modify the list of owners for your website or domain.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The id of a verified site or domain.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Relinquish ownership of a website or domain.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The id of a verified site or domain.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Get the most current data for a website or domain.

pathParams.name: id
pathParams.desc: The id of a verified site or domain.
